markings: verso URC, Thomas Murray Collection label: OKI 6031 | verso URC, Jack Lenor Larsen label: 890 5B | verso LL, orange Larsen label: 890 5B
text: Uchikui, like furoshiki on mainland Japan, are heavy cloths used for wrapping gifts and other goods. Typical for uchikui, polychromatic designs—in this case of chrysanthemums, peonies, and other florals surrounding a rocky outcrop—are set against a dark indigo ground. Three panels of plain-weave, heavy-grade ramie, a fabric made from the fibers of nettle plants, were joined together. Largescale uchikui woven from stiff and strong fibers were often used to cover furniture or other large household items.
title: Wrapping cloth (uchikui) with directional floral design
